feed.title: blank
feed.subtitle: A software engineer and AI researcher focusing on natural language processing and machine learning. Created custom NLP solutions, such as an Afaan Oromo News Classification System and an Amharic Context-Aware Spell Checker

entry.title: Teaching a robot its limits, to complete open-ended tasks safely

link.title: Teaching a robot its limits, to complete open-ended tasks safely

entry.summary: The “PRoC3S” method helps an LLM create a viable action plan by testing each step in a simulation. This strategy could eventually aid in-home robots to complete more ambiguous chore requests.

entry.title: AI in health should be regulated, but don’t forget about the algorithms, researchers say

link.title: AI in health should be regulated, but don’t forget about the algorithms, researchers say

entry.summary: In a recent commentary, a team from MIT, Equality AI, and Boston University highlights the gaps in regulation for AI models and non-AI algorithms in health care.

entry.title: Researchers reduce bias in AI models while preserving or improving accuracy

link.title: Researchers reduce bias in AI models while preserving or improving accuracy

entry.summary: A new technique identifies and removes the training examples that contribute most to a machine-learning model’s failures.

entry.title: Study: Some language reward models exhibit political bias

link.title: Study: Some language reward models exhibit political bias

entry.summary: Research from the MIT Center for Constructive Communication finds this effect occurs even when reward models are trained on factual data.

entry.title: Enabling AI to explain its predictions in plain language

link.title: Enabling AI to explain its predictions in plain language

entry.summary: Using LLMs to convert machine-learning explanations into readable narratives could help users make better decisions about when to trust a model.

entry.title: Daniela Rus wins John Scott Award

link.title: Daniela Rus wins John Scott Award

entry.summary: MIT CSAIL director and EECS professor named a co-recipient of the honor for her robotics research, which has expanded our understanding of what a robot can be.

entry.title: Citation tool offers a new approach to trustworthy AI-generated content

link.title: Citation tool offers a new approach to trustworthy AI-generated content

entry.summary: Researchers develop “ContextCite,” an innovative method to track AI’s source attribution and detect potential misinformation.

entry.title: What do we know about the economics of AI?

link.title: What do we know about the economics of AI?

entry.summary: Nobel laureate Daron Acemoglu has long studied technology-driven growth. Here’s how he’s thinking about AI’s effect on the economy.

entry.title: Study: Browsing negative content online makes mental health struggles worse

link.title: Study: Browsing negative content online makes mental health struggles worse

entry.summary: Researchers have developed a web plug-in to help those looking to protect their mental health make more informed decisions.

entry.title: Want to design the car of the future? Here are 8,000 designs to get you started.

link.title: Want to design the car of the future? Here are 8,000 designs to get you started.

entry.summary: MIT engineers developed the largest open-source dataset of car designs, including their aerodynamics, that could speed design of eco-friendly cars and electric vehicles.
